context: Forward-facing dashcam view of a city street with parked cars along the right curb and a pedestrian running on the sidewalk.
perception: The vehicle is on a one-way street with parallel parked cars on the right side. The road is clear ahead with no visible traffic signals or signs in the immediate view. A pedestrian is running on the sidewalk to the right, approaching the street corner. The curb has a red-painted section indicating a no-parking zone near the corner. The weather is clear and visibility is good.
prediction: The pedestrian may attempt to cross the street soon, given their proximity to the corner. Parked cars may also start to move or open doors unexpectedly.
planning: Proceed with caution, reduce speed, and prepare to yield to any pedestrian crossing. Maintain a safe distance from the parked cars to avoid sudden obstacles.
